intro: Drabella thylacocarpa, commonly known as the tiger's claw draba, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Drabella thylacocarpa is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
